availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Throop (Mason County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of George L. Throop. Married to Mary Throop. Father of H. S. Throop, C. S. Throop, Lilly S. Throop, Thomas P. Throop, and Mary Throop. Attorney in Shelby County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Shelby County in 1850. Attorney in Mason County in 1860. Employed Sylvia as a servant in Maysville in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860. Resident of Mason County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 2, p. 343A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 2, p. 775, p. 1 of 33 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, East Maysville, p. 366.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 5A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville Ward 2, p. 417A.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 15, Mason County, Kentucky, 1863, p. 121, p. 529 of 754 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
